channel.title: Comments on: Upgrading SSD in Apple MacBook Pro Retina (Late 2012)
channel.description: Intermediate in flow properties between solids and liquids; highly viscous.

item.title: By: Faizan
item.dc:creator: Faizan
item.description: Hello! Sorry to bother but this process is pretty daunting for a n00b. I bought https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B078WQT6S6/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 for my MacBook Pro Retina, 13", late-2012 -- but it seems as though it may not be compatible? What do you think? Do I need to get a new thingymajig to connect them?
item.content:encoded: Hello! Sorry to bother but this process is pretty daunting for a n00b. I bought https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B078WQT6S6/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 for my MacBook Pro Retina, 13″, late-2012 — but it seems as though it may not be compatible? What do you think? Do I need to get a new thingymajig to connect them?

item.title: By: Mike
item.dc:creator: Mike
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/04/03/upgrading-ssd-in-apple-macbook-pro-retina-late-2012/#comment-217045">Caleb</a>.
Hey Caleb, did you ever install the Crucial MX500 500GB M.2 Type 2280? If so, how is it? I'm looking to do the same.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Caleb.

Hey Caleb, did you ever install the Crucial MX500 500GB M.2 Type 2280? If so, how is it? I’m looking to do the same.

item.title: By: Ricardo
item.dc:creator: Ricardo
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016/04/03/upgrading-ssd-in-apple-macbook-pro-retina-late-2012/#comment-215922">Carlo C</a>.
Hi Carlo! What Evo 860 did you buy? mSata or M.2? if M.2, did it fit ? Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Carlo C.

Hi Carlo! What Evo 860 did you buy? mSata or M.2? if M.2, did it fit ? Thanks!

item.title: By: Carlo C
item.dc:creator: Carlo C
item.description: Thank you Steven for writing this article. It really helped me upgrade my late-2012 rMBP. I used Samsung EVO 860 and Qnine adapter. So far so good. Installed High Sierra OS. So far no problems yet of slowing down. currently at 471Mb/s write speed and 501Mb/s read speed. Though on the first couple hours when File Vault was encrypting, my macbook was running really slow. but now it's back up to blazing speed as of this moment.
item.content:encoded: Thank you Steven for writing this article. It really helped me upgrade my late-2012 rMBP. I used Samsung EVO 860 and Qnine adapter. So far so good. Installed High Sierra OS. So far no problems yet of slowing down. currently at 471Mb/s write speed and 501Mb/s read speed. Though on the first couple hours when File Vault was encrypting, my macbook was running really slow. but now it’s back up to blazing speed as of this moment.
